title: Bug 3666CodeCompletion Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)
description: Bug 3666CodeCompletionHungry code assist (1GDRYW5) jkca (5/15/2001 11:04:56 AM)jresdk 106Under certain circumstances code assist eats too much code.Consider the enclosed class.As a programmer, I must add aparameter to the baz call in bar to make the program correct.Steps:1. UI can decide whether it wants to use the codeassist end position (until the end of current identifier) or the cursor location it used to start with, so as to controlthe amount of source to replace. Removing codeassist option.
OB: Under certain circumstances, the code assist feature consumes excessive code in the enclosed class. Specifically, when calling the 'baz' method in the 'bar' method, it is necessary to add a parameter to the 'baz' call for the program to be correct.
EB: The 'baz' method call in the 'bar' method should be changed to: baz(x.foo().foo()). This change ensures that the correct code is generated. The modified class code should be:public class X {void bar(X x) {baz(x.foo().foo());}int foo() {return 5;}void baz(int i, int j) {}}
SR: To reproduce the issue:1. Open the provided class 'X'.2. Locate the 'bar' method.3. Observe that the 'baz' method call lacks a required parameter.4. Add the missing parameter to the 'baz' method call.
